name: n-hexyl acetate
Reason: The basic unit for this compound can be considered hexane, which has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The introduction of an acetate group (O=C(C)OCCCCCC) increases the melting point due to the presence of a carbonyl group, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and form a more rigid structure. The hexyl group (CCCCCC) also contributes to the melting point due to its increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces.
